intro: Leucactinia bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate leucactinia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and compound leaves with a finely divided structure. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
